ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: During the course we touched most of the basic of ethics in a lab environment which are concepts I previously knew but it's good to keep talking about them to keep them present. Also, I learned some aspects about the resources in the university.
General ethics in research, some patent law, etc
Ethics and research.
the general ideas about scientific research such as data processing, conflict of interest, animal research and so on.
I learned about the NIH required ethics training.
Not too much but was still interesting to review.

General knowledge about the graduate school experience from professors. Very good advice on critical thinking and also how to deal with situations that may require knowledge in ethics. Also learned about resources available for students.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It's well structured. Yet, some lectures where really repetitive with something discussed in a previous week.
I enjoyed the discussion format of the course

The teachers are very experienced so that we can learn about what they have faced and prevent us from making the same mistake. It would be better if we can get one-slide summary from each teacher which is easier for us to memorize.
I think that most of the discussions managed to be fun and interesting even though the material was all stipulated by the NIH.

Strengths: I liked the relaxed atmosphere of most of the sessions, and the cookies. Weaknesses: I was disappointed at how few of the sessions actually discussed ethical issues. A large number of the discussion were instead about various practicalities of grad school and science work that could have been discussed at another time.
I was worried that it would be just reading out of the book and really boring but the professors made it way more interesting with their stories and more real life examples.
There was no announcement about the first class meeting, so some students missed it.
Very good course.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if you're new in science or need to refresh some concepts, it's a great way to do so.
Its required
It's requried
Yes
Yes, it is very useful for us to learn these story and proper methods to solve issues are required for a good scientist.
Yes because it is required.
Yes - plus its mandatory!
Yes, I would recommend this course to other students. It is very helpful to hear about the graduate experience from professors.
